H.M* Secretary of State for India, London, sX 2. The Secretary to the Government of India in the iSxternal Affairs Department, Simla, 3. H.M. Minister, Jedda, and has the honour to transmit to him a copy of the undermentioned docu ment (s). British Consulate-General, BUSHIRE. Dm ted* 16 th Apr i 1 1940, Reference to previous correspondence Description of Enclosure. Name and Date 1, Bahrain telegram No,105 dated 15th April 1940. 2, Bolitieal Resident*s telegram No.167 dated 16th April 1940. Subject. Censorshipn iO '*• Jf r ' Jfil ■ Q ^ o k < n J u U i940 0 i_J Political Agent, Bahrain. Political Resident, Bushire Telegram Prom To No.105 Bated and received 15th April 1940 Cypher telegram was received in Bahrain last night from Amir Saud to ^osaihi. Delivery was permitted. 2. Though this is objectionable as Qosaibi has no diplomatic status I think we should connive at to use of cypher in messages to and from Ibn Saud and the two principal Amirs. Bo you agree ? Political ,

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: PZ 2540/40 'Censorship: connivance at use of cypher in messages to and from Ibn Saud and the two Amirs'

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: the foliation sequence for this description commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 5; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file contains two telegrams about the use of cypher in messages between Ibn Saud [‘Abd al-‘Azīz bin ‘Abd al-Raḥmān bin Fayṣal Āl Sa‘ūd] and the Political Agent, Bahrain and the Political Resident, Bushire.
